content:
How did you manage to negotiate the price down? 

I managed to negotiate the price down by explaining my situation as a student and my budget constraints. I also mentioned that I was willing to commit to a longer-term lease, which might have made Peter Schmidt more willing to negotiate.
name: Evaluator

content:
[Question] What was your initial offer for the rental price? 

My initial offer for the rental price was €1,000 per month. I felt this was a fair offer considering the apartment was unfurnished and I was a student on a tight budget. [

[Question] What was Peter Schmidt's final offer before you settled on the price? 

Peter Schmidt's final offer before we settled on the price was €1,375 per month. He was being very reasonable, considering the quality and location of the apartment. [

[Question] How many times did you change your offer during the negotiation? 

I changed my offer three times during the negotiation. I started at €1,000, then moved to €1,200, and finally settled on €1,300. [

[Question] How many times did Peter Schmidt change his offer during the negotiation? 

Peter Schmidt changed his offer twice during the negotiation. He started at €1,500, then moved to €1,400, and finally settled on €1,375. [

[Question] At what point did you reach an agreement on the price? 

We reached an agreement on the price after the third round of negotiations. [

[Question] How did you feel about the negotiation process? 

I felt that the negotiation process was fair and reasonable. Both parties expressed their needs and worked towards a mutually beneficial agreement. [

[Question] Did you feel that Peter Schmidt was being reasonable during the negotiation? 

Yes, I felt that Peter Schmidt was being reasonable during the negotiation. He was willing to negotiate and understood my situation as a student. [

[Question] Did you feel that your status as a student affected the negotiation? 

Yes, I believe my status as a student affected the negotiation. Peter Schmidt seemed to understand my budget constraints and was willing to negotiate the price. [

[Question] What was the final price that you agreed upon for the apartment? 

We agreed upon a price of €1,300 per month for the apartment. [

[Question] Why did you decide to settle on that price? 

I decided to settle on that price because it was a reasonable compromise between my budget and Peter Schmidt's need to cover his costs and make a profit. [

[Question] Looking back, do you think there was anything you could have done differently during the negotiation? 

Looking back, I don't think there was anything I could have done differently during the negotiation. I was clear about my needs and willing to compromise, which is what led to a successful negotiation.
name: Emilia Müller
